intro: Odontostemma membranisepalum, commonly known as the membrane-sepal odontostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, membranous sepals that are often mistaken for petals. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
